subject: Law
title: Obergefell v. Hodges: Marriage Equality
description: One-minute skill: Obergefell v. Hodges: Marriage Equality.

hook.text: Jim Obergefell married John Arthur on a medical plane in Maryland. Ohio refused to recognize it. He sued.

buildup.text: Same-sex marriage bans existed in many states, denying couples legal recognition and hundreds of federal benefits.

discovery.text: In 2015, the Supreme Court ruled 5-4 that same-sex couples have a fundamental right to marry under the 14th Amendment.

twist.text: Justice Kennedy wrote that the Constitution's meaning is not frozen in timeâ€”it evolves with society's understanding.

climax.text: The ruling immediately legalized same-sex marriage in all fifty states.

punchline.text: Love asked for equal dignity. The law answered.

quiz.question: Under which amendment did Obergefell find the right to same-sex marriage?
